text: Psalm 122
Jerusalem the Site of God’s Presence
A song of ascents. Of David.\f + \fr Ps 122 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
I rejoiced in \add those who\add* said to me,
“Let us go to the house\f + \fr 122:1 \ft Or “temple” \f* of Yahweh.”
Our feet are standing
within your gates, O Jerusalem—
Jerusalem that is built
as a city that is joined together,
where \add the\add* tribes go up,
the tribes of Yah\f + \fr 122:4 \ft A shortened form of “Yahweh” \f* \add as\add* a testimony for Israel,
to give thanks to the name of Yahweh.
For there \add the\add* thrones sit\f + \fr 122:5 \ft That is, rulers or judges on thrones \f* for judgment,
thrones of David’s house.
Pray\f + \fr 122:6 \ft Hebrew “Ask” \f* for the peace of Jerusalem:
“May those who love you be at ease.
May peace be within your walls,
security within your palaces.”
For the sake of my brothers and my friends,
I will say, “Peace \add be\add* within you.”
For the sake of the house\f + \fr 122:9 \ft Or “temple” \f* of Yahweh our God,
I will seek your good.
